intro: Kohautia schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has small, hairy stems and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Kohautia schimperi is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
